problems.content: Consider the circuit in. Suppose that

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Use a series of source transformations to find i<sub>0</sub> in the circuit.

parts.title: Part B

problems.title: Problem 2
problems.content: A Thevenin equivalent can also be determined from measurements made at the pair of terminals of interest. Assume the following measurements were made at the terminals a, b in the circuit in. When a <input id='p2-R1' type='number'> Ω resistor is connected to the terminals a, b, the voltage v<sub>ab</sub> is measured and found to be <input id='p2-V1' type='number'> V. When a <input id='p2-R2' type='number'> Ω resistor is connected to the terminals a, b, the voltage is measured and found to be <input id='p2-V2' type='number'> V. Find the Thevenin equivalent of the network with respect to the terminals a, b.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find the equivalent voltage.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the equivalent resistance.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Solve for the Thevenin resistance by removing the independent sources.

problems.title: Problem 5
problems.content: The variable resistor in the circuit in is adjusted for maximum power transfer to R<sub>0</sub>. Suppose that

parts.title: Part D
